keyMoments.title: Recovers from Gigant Pistol
keyMoments.description: Despite taking a devastating Gomu Gomu no Gigant Pistol attack, Lucci manages to get back up and continue fighting, demonstrating his incredible durability and willpower.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Lucci as an opponent who won't go down easily, even against Gear Third attacks.
keyMoments.quote: I can't afford to fall into the water... I must continue fighting.

keyMoments.title: The 500 Hostages Incident Revealed
keyMoments.description: Flashback reveals that at age 13, Lucci was sent by the World Government to resolve a hostage crisis involving 500 soldiers. Instead of rescuing them, he murdered all 500 hostages to eliminate 'weakness' and remove the pirates' bargaining power.
keyMoments.significance: This is the defining moment that explains Lucci's entire character - his Dark Justice philosophy, his ruthlessness, and his belief that weakness deserves death. It establishes him as one of the darkest antagonists in One Piece.
keyMoments.quote: Weakness is a sin. These soldiers who allowed themselves to be captured have no right to live.

keyMoments.title: First Use of Rankyaku: Gaicho
keyMoments.description: Lucci unleashes Rankyaku: Gaicho, a powerful bird-shaped compressed air blade created with his claws that can cleave through battleship hulls.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Lucci's mastery of Rokushiki and how he combines it with his Zoan Devil Fruit powers.

abilities.description: A powerful bird-shaped compressed air blade created with claws that can cut through battleship hulls.

reveals.information: At age 13, killed 500 hostages during a pirate crisis, establishing his Dark Justice philosophy
Believes weakness is a sin and the strong have the right to eliminate the weak. Joined CP9 to be legally allowed to kill.
Can use Rankyaku: Gaicho, a devastating bird-shaped air blade attack

keyMoments.title: First Use of Gomu Gomu no Gigant Axe
keyMoments.description: Luffy inflates his leg bone and brings it down in a devastating axe-kick attack, destroying part of a Marine battleship.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces another Gear Third variation, expanding Luffy's combat arsenal.

keyMoments.title: First Use of Gomu Gomu no Gigant Whip
keyMoments.description: Luffy inflates his leg and swings it in a wide arc, creating a whip-like attack that destroys ship masts.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Gear Third's versatility for wide-area attacks and structural destruction.

abilities.description: Luffy inflates his leg bone and brings it down in a devastating axe-kick attack.
Luffy inflates his leg and swings it in a wide arc, creating a powerful whip-like attack.

reveals.information: Learned Gomu Gomu no Gigant Axe - Gear Third axe-kick technique
Learned Gomu Gomu no Gigant Whip - Gear Third whip technique

keyMoments.title: Recounts Rob Lucci's Dark Past
keyMoments.description: Vice-Admiral Doberman tells his subordinates about the incident from 15 years ago where 13-year-old Rob Lucci killed 500 hostages, providing crucial backstory for understanding Lucci's character.
keyMoments.significance: Serves as the narrator for one of the most important villain backstories in One Piece, explaining Lucci's Dark Justice philosophy.
keyMoments.quote: Let me tell you about Rob Lucci... and the incident from 15 years ago.

keyMoments.title: Orders Fire on His Own Ship
keyMoments.description: Onigumo coldly orders his forces to fire upon a Marine battleship containing Luffy and Lucci, despite it being full of his own men. When a subordinate protests, Onigumo shoots him and repeats the order.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the ruthless 'Absolute Justice' philosophy, showing that Marine leadership can be as morally questionable as their enemies. Parallels Lucci's Dark Justice by valuing mission success over individual lives.
keyMoments.quote: Fire on ship number 4. Lucci will survive, and that's all that matters.

reveals.information: Willing to sacrifice his own men to achieve mission objectives, embodying 'Absolute Justice' philosophy
